Reviews.Content: Don't stay here. It was not centrally located. It was dirty. The guy at the desk was completely unhelpful. I do not recommend anyone stay here.
Reviews.Author: nicruns

Reviews.Content: Not terrible, but not the nicest either....       Our Room
Reviews.Author: JBMax

Reviews.Content: Really Not a good place to stay!! We booked this hotel through Hotel Club, it is listed as a 3 star hotel.Basically it's a 1 star at best!!! Its 30 minutes hike from the train station, through not the pleasantest of areas, the streets have condom machines on them which makes you wonder.When we arrived there the guy on the desk told us nothing about when or where breakfast was or what time check out was. When we found our room - bearing in mind we had made them aware we were on honeymoon, half the door frame was missing, in the room the walls were all cracked and had holes in them where clearly a TV bracket had been but had probably fallen off! The windows did not close properly, the floor wasn't clean. The bedding was clean as were the towels but very tired and both had holes in.Because the windows didn't close properly it was noisy and the 'view' not very nice at all.It is again 30 minutes walk to any half decent restaurants.The following morning, we were told where breakfast was, at first glance this seemed ok, but on checking and tasting we were very dissappointed. Firstly, the coffee tasted burnt, the bread was dry and tasteless, the orange juice - well I think it was orange juice - you didn't wan't to try, it didn't look very nice! The hot chocolate was terrible. The ham and cheese were very thin processed slices on a plate under a light so were warm and sweaty! The cereal selection consited of basically tesco's value cornflakes!All in all we were very very dissapointed, we really didn't like the place at all, fortunately we were only staying for one night so we coped but we strongly recomended you avoid this place as you would Bernard Matthews Turkeys!Had we not already paid we would have turned around and walked another 40 minutes or so (with our 20 kilo rucksacks) and found somewhere else. We will post some photo's when we get home but we're still on honeymoon but wanted to get a post up about this place as soon as possible.
Reviews.Author: mini_monkey

Reviews.Content: Please Stay away!!!!       Picture of the TV
Reviews.Author: Worldfriendly

Reviews.Content: Stay Away from this Fleabag hotel First, the hotel looks nothing like the pictures. Secondly its in a very shoddy neighborhood, upon arrival we got to see a guy on a moped taken out in a head on collission, great place to park! Third the staff were terrible, the one in particular refused to speak english on the phone when we wanted to clarify the address but had no problems speaking english when we were in front of him. Its terribly difficult to find, dirty, small, there is no reason to stay here, in fact after viewing it and having my wife in tears and my sisters family refusing to stay I had to suck it up and spring for the local holiday inn to the tune of 300 euro for the night. Florence is one of the more expensive cities and if you cant afford a hotel better than this one you should consider skipping it altogether.
Reviews.Author: nugsfan

Reviews.Content: Avoid!! We booked into the Hotel Airone through the Ryanair website for three nights. We stayed for one. We would not consider ourselves particularly fussy, but pleasant staff and basic cleanliness are not too much to ask for, and there is NO WAY that this should be considered to be a three star hotel. Firstly, it is not as described in terms of distance from the centre of Florence, which we swiftly realised when in the taxi from the main station. We did not think it was a very good sign in the first place when the driver had not heard of the hotel and we had to show him it on the map. The taxi cost around 拢8 and the hotel is quite far out from the centre. The neighbourhood did not feel particularly safe, to be honest. When we went into the hotel, we were barked at by the receptionist to close the door for the air conditioning, despite the fact that we were in the process of lifting our cases in at the time! Once inside the tiny reception area, she then proceeded to ignore us for the next few minutes while she finished looking at whatever it was on the computer that she was looking at. When she eventually turned round, it was to say that rooms are not ready until two o'clock (it was just after one o'clock) and that we would have to go away and come back again. No offer of anywhere TO wait, but she did indicate that we could leave the cases downstairs in the 'TV room'. At this point, without even having seen the room, we had decided that we did not want to stay there! This was confirmed when we went down in the lift to the basement tv room and breakfast area, which was tiny, poky and stuffy. We then decided to walk into town to find another hotel. This took 45 minutes in the boiling heat. We would have taken our cases there and then but did not want to risk having nowhere to stay for the night and this would have made our trek even more unbearable. As it turned out, we had to stay at Airone for one night, but booked into a central hotel for the remaining two. When we went back to Airone to get into our room, there was a lovely older Italian man on reception (the owner?) and he couldn't have been nicer, unlike the first woman! He didn't speak any English, but gave us a map of the city and pointed out highlights, giving us the numbers of buses to take etc. The room was like a prison cell - the shutters on the windows had to stay shut to give any privacy at all due to how overlooked the hotel is, there were no curtains, a grubby bedspread and camp-bed type thing and a foul, stale smell. The floor tiles resembled those rusty coloured ones that you find in old public toilets. There was a huge ceiling fan that wobbled dangerously as it spun round and looked like it was about to fall off at any minute. The mini bar was a joke - it had a couple of cans of orange and you could not open it properly due to where it was squeezed into. The bathroom, on the other hand, was clean and looked like it had been modernised fairly recently. Pity we could not say the same for the room itself. In the morning, having decided that we would at least have one breakfast for our money, we went down to the breakfast area at 9am (breakfast is between 7.30 and 9.30). There was no-one to be seen, no food apart from two stale pieces of bread in a bread bin, and a couple of tables with breakfast remains that had not been cleared away. No-one came near us, the stale air was unbearable, and so we just left. The 'garden area' that is mentioned on both the Ryanair and the hotel websites consisted of a couple of concrete slabs and a few plants! Overall, I would certainly NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. Even if on a budget, you can find affordable accommodation in the centre of Florence and save yourelf the taxi fares. The city itself is absolutely beautiful and the rest of the service we received whilst there was excellent. We will definitely go back to Florence, but will be giving the Hotel Airone a wide berth!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not as Described Stayed here for 3 nights. Booked through Ryanairs website. Hotel OK but not as stated in description. In description it says 15min walk to centre, room service and mini bar. It was more like 30 mins walk to centre, there was no room serviced and no mini bar. We arrived at midnight after travelling for 8 hours and all we wanted was a cup of tea but no room service so no tea. A taxi from Santa Maria Novella Station to Hotel Airone cost us 拢7.00. Bed was a little uncomfortable, woke in mornings with aching back. OK if you're on a budget and don't mind a long walk to the centre and back.
Reviews.Author: mr.w.bone

Reviews.Content: average but friendly we have just returned fron Airone hotel Florence where the culture is brilliant.Was a bit disappointed with the hotel but for price we payed it was a good enough hotel but for no longer than a couple of days.The tallest of the 2 girls on reception could not go out of her way enough to help us on our stay advising on cuisine and times and places to go.ie osteria restruant 5 min walk was typical florentine cuisine and i would recommend it 100 %.Again service brilliant going out of theyre way to cook out of hours.All the hotel needs is a good lick of paint and a little upgrading ive stayed in more aworse and more expensive.Average would possibly stay again bu a little out of the way.
Reviews.Author: taikos38

Reviews.Content: We would avoid it If I have the chance to go back to the beginning of my trip, I would avoid this hotel. Major concerns: Only a curtain covers the shower stall, so after shower we have to clean up the bathroom, bathroom was not clean when we came, neighborhood is somewhat scary, room cleanliness was definitely in doubt my wife would not take off her sandal. Sure, the staff was very helpful, but that did not cover the minus of this hotel.Overall, I think Florence is overrated. The city is really dirty that we don't see the 'Renaissance' about this city at all. My advise if you visit Florence, stay in the suburb. The city is proclaimed to be compact that you better off stay in the suburb and take the train to the city. From the station, you can walk anywhere.
Reviews.Author: Wilibona

Reviews.Content: Price vs quality is okay, but not the best choice Very far from the centre (about 30 min walking), and the bathroom is too small. There are no shower curtains, or cabin, or whatever - water just flows on the floor.Good thing - it is rather quiet, comparing to other hotels we`ve stayed in Italy.We paid 60 EUR per night for a double room - it doesn`t cost more.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Decent, but miles from town Room was decent enough, but it is not within walking distance of the train station or any of the sights. Taxis were very hard to come by as well and the bus service can't be relied on (it seems to stop at 1pm on sundays and buying tickets can be very difficult)
Reviews.Author: willgo79
